items.sentence: Pets aren\'t allowed in the apartment building where I live.
Tom waited an hour in the hallway outside Mary\'s apartment.
This is the TV station where my uncle works as an announcer.
Tom and Mary climbed all the way to the top of the mountain.
Tom has two sons. One is a doctor and the other is a lawyer.
I have an important meeting I have to attend this afternoon.
I have told Tom over and over again not to make fun of Mary.
Tom and his friends chopped down every tree on his property.
Tom asked Mary if she wanted to come over and watch a movie.
Tom asked Mary if she was planning to work on Christmas Day.
Tom is better at speaking French than any of his classmates.
Tom went to Australia and stayed there the rest of his life.
Tom wondered if Mary would slap him if he tried to kiss her.
I gave Tom my word that I wouldn\'t talk to Mary about that.
When was the last time you had to remind me to do something?
When was the last time you told your wife she was beautiful?
Which player are you paying the most attention to this year?
If I were you, I\'d think twice before going down that path.
It\'s one of the most difficult things I\'ve ever had to do.
Tom didn\'t feel he could do what Mary was asking him to do.
Tom didn\'t get up this morning as early as he usually does.
I\'m pretty sure Tom doesn\'t enjoy watching baseball on TV.
How were you able to stay so calm in such a scary situation?
Tom sat alone at the table with a half-empty bottle of wine.
Everybody was afraid that something bad was going to happen.
Barcodes have made getting through the checkout much faster.
We\'ll have known each other for three years next Christmas.
Tom made it quite clear who we weren\'t supposed to talk to.
This food is delicious. Where did you learn to cook so well?
Tom bargained with the salesman hoping to get a lower price.
Some of my friends think Boston isn\'t a safe place to live.
Tom doesn\'t have to talk about that if he doesn\'t want to.
Tom smuggled a bottle of whiskey into Mary\'s hospital room.
Tom would never have let us go if Mary hadn\'t gone with us.
Tom said that he didn\'t know Mary was able to speak French.
Tom was going to go hang gliding, but then he chickened out.
Tom was supposed to hand in his homework before the weekend.
Tom told Mary that he couldn\'t do what she asked him to do.
Please don\'t forget to put out the fire before you go home.
Tom asked Mary if she would be willing to donate some money.
Tom asked Mary some questions that she was unable to answer.
Tom asked Mary three times to marry him before she said yes.
Tom took Mary\'s hand, brought it to his lips and kissed it.
I\'m not sure that Tom is going to be willing to talk to me.
I thought you\'d like to know who\'s coming over for dinner.
Tom and Mary\'s relationship fizzled out after a few months.
Mr. Jackson was my French teacher when I was in high school.
You aren\'t really going to buy Tom\'s old tractor, are you?
Mary used the apples that Tom gave her to make apple butter.
I\'m sure Tom will get around to doing that sooner or later.
